EXISTING STRUCTURES
──────────────────────
### Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network at positions (0.0, 0.0), (5.0, 0.0), (2.5, 0.5) & (2.5, -0.5)
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace for Iron Smelting at (0.0, 0.0)
 – Stone Furnace at (0.0, 0.0) paired with a Burner Inserter at (1.5, 0.5).
• Stone Furnace for Copper Smelting at (5.0, 0.0)
 – Stone Furnace at (5.0, 0.0) with an associated Burner Inserter at (3.5, 0.5).
• Common Input Chest:
 – Wooden Chest at (2.5, 0.5) stocking copper-plate.
• New Feeder Inserter:
 – Feeder Inserter at (2.5, -0.5) with pickup at (2.5, -1.5) and drop at (2.5, 0.5).
• Transport Belt Connection:
 – BeltGroup linking mining output at (-14.5, -47.5) to the feeder inserter pickup at (2.5, -1.5) using 64 belts.

### Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup at position (-15.0, -50.0)
Consists of:
• Burner Mining Drill at (-15.0, -50.0)
 – Positioned with a drop at (-14.5, -48.5); currently in a NO_FUEL state after recent fuel management issues.
• Drill Inserter at (-13.5, -47.5)
 – Transfers ore from the mining drill.
• Output Sink & Extraction System:
 – Previously, a Wooden Chest at (-14.5, -48.5) served as the sink.
 – Due to persistent extraction blockages, that chest was removed and replaced.
 – New Wooden Chest now placed at (-14.5, -51.5) functions as the output sink.
• Belt Network Remnants:
 – The existing belt segments connecting the mining drill drop to the smelting network remain unchanged despite multiple failed attempts to attach an output inserter.
• Note:
 – Repeated attempts to place an output inserter adjacent to the sink chest (using various spacings and directions) resulted in placement conflicts; hence, no output inserter was successfully integrated.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Output Inserter Placement Conflicts:
 – Verify available spacing and adjust the reference position, spacing, or direction to avoid overlapping with existing burner-inserters or transport belts.
• Entity Rotation and Validation Errors:
 – Ensure that a valid entity instance exists before attempting rotation to prevent “The first argument must be an Entity object” errors.
• Transport Belt Placement Failures:
 – Confirm that the target tile is free from existing entities so that transport belt functions do not receive a NoneType input.
• Sink Chest Output Blockage:
 – Regularly clear sink chest inventories to eliminate “chest at drop position is full” issues and consider repositioning the sink when blockages persist.
• Fuel Management for Mining Drills:
 – Monitor fuel levels and refuel promptly to prevent mining drills from entering a NO_FUEL state.
• Type Misuse in Position Handling:
 – Avoid treating Position objects as callable; access properties directly without using function-call syntax.

NAMESPACE
─────────
• shift_entity_local(entity: Entity, offset: Tuple[float, float]) -> Entity
 – Shifts the given entity’s position by the specified offset.
  – Invocation feedback: Successful repositioning recorded, with caution advised for later adjustments.

Important Variables:
• furnace_input_chest_pos (Position) – Holds the position of the furnace’s input chest.
• current_player_inventory (Inventory) – Tracks the current state of the player’s inventory.
